channel.title: Devblogs.microsoft.com on .NET Ramblings
channel.description: Recent content in Devblogs.microsoft.com on .NET Ramblings

item.title: Studying compiler error messages closely: Input file paths
item.description: A colleague was working in a project that used a number of data files to configure how the program worked. They wanted one portion of the configuration file to be included only if a particular build flag was set. Let's say that the configuration file is C:\repos\contoso\config\Contoso.config. & Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/oldnewthing/20260202-00/?p=112027

item.title: Build AI Agents with Claude Agent SDK and Microsoft Agent Framework
item.description: Microsoft Agent Framework now integrates with the Claude Agent SDK, enabling you to build AI agents powered by Claude's full agentic capabilities. This integration brings together the Agent Framework's consistent agent abstraction with Claude's powerful features, including fil Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/semantic-kernel/build-ai-agents-with-claude-agent-sdk-and-microsoft-agent-framework

item.title: Why not store the SAFEARRAY reference count as a hidden allocation next to the SAFEARRAY?

item.title: Azure SDK Release (January 2026)
item.description: Thank you for your interest in the new Azure SDKs! We release new features, improvements, and bug fixes every month. Subscribe to our Azure SDK Blog RSS Feed to get notified when a new release is available. You can find links to packages, code, and docs on our Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/azure-sdk/azure-sdk-release-january-2026

item.description: In Episode 111 of Azure Cosmos DB TV, host Mark Brown is joined by Yohan Lasorsa to explore how developers can build agent-powered applications using a fully serverless architecture. item.title: How can I retain access to the data in a SAFEARRAY after my method returns?
item.description: The original problem our customer had was that the data in a SAFEARRAY disappeared even though they had called Safe­Array­Add­Ref. We learned why this is the case, Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/oldnewthing/20260129-00/?p=112023

item.title: Dev Proxy v2.1 with configuration hot reload and stdio proxying
item.description: We're excited to announce the release of Dev Proxy v2.1.0! This release brings two major productivity features that developers have been asking for: automatic configuration hot reload and stdio traffic proxying - perfect for testing MCP servers and other stdio-based tools. In this version: Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/microsoft365dev/dev-proxy-v2-1-with-configuration-hot-reload-and-stdio-proxying

item.title: Introducing the Microsoft Graph User Configuration API (preview)
item.description: We’re excited to announce the public preview of the User Configuration API in the Microsoft Graph beta endpoint. The User Configuration API is a new set of endpoints that you can use to create, read, update, and delete user configuration objects in Exchange Online mail folders. User configuration objects—also Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/microsoft365dev/introducing-the-microsoft-graph-user-configuration-api-preview

item.title: Diagnosing instability in production-scale agent reinforcement learning
item.description: On January 28, 2026, Hugging Face announced that they have upstreamed the Post-Training Toolkit into TRL as a first-party integration, making these diagnostics directly usable in production RL and agent post-training pipelines. This enables closed-loop monitoring and control patterns that are increasingly necessary for Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/engineering-at-microsoft/diagnosing-instability-in-production-scale-agent-rl

item.title: Accelerate Your Cosmos DB Infrastructure with GitHub Copilot CLI and Azure Cosmos DB Agent Kit
item.description: Modern infrastructure work is increasingly agent driven, but only if your AI actually understands the platform you’re deploying. This guide shows how to turn GitHub Copilot CLI into an Azure Cosmos DB aware infrastructure expert by loading the Azure Cosmos DB Agent Kit. In under a minute, you’ll give Copil Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/cosmosdb/accelerate-your-cosmos-db-infrastructure-with-github-copilot-cli-and-azure-cosmos-db-agent-kit

item.title: .NET AI Essentials - The Core Building Blocks Explained
item.description: Artificial Intelligence (AI) is transforming how we build applications. The .NET team has prioritized keeping pace with the rapid changes in generative AI and continue to provide tools, libraries, and guidance for .NET developers building intelligent apps. With .NET, developers have a powerful ecosystem to integrate AI seamlessly into their ap Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/dotnet/dotnet-ai-essentials-the-core-building-blocks-explained

item.title: SharePoint Framework (SPFx) roadmap update – January 2026
item.description: We enter 2026 with the SharePoint Framework stronger than ever. Adoption has expanded, feedback has sharpened our priorities, and the platform continues to power intelligent and scalable experiences across Microsoft 365. December marked an important milestone with the release of Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/microsoft365dev/sharepoint-framework-spfx-roadmap-update-january-2026

item.title: Why did I lose the data even though I called Safe­Array­Add­Ref?
item.description: A customer had a method that received a SAFEARRAY, and they called Safe­Array­Add­Ref to add a reference to it so that they could continue using the array after the method returned, but they found that if they tried to use the array later, the safearray->pData was NULL, and if they c Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/oldnewthing/20260128-00/?p=112021

item.title: Introducing Budget Bytes: Build Powerful AI Apps for Under $25
item.description: When developers hear "cloud" and "AI," their first thought is often about cost. "How much will this cost me to learn? Can I build something meaningful without racking up a surprise bill?" Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/azure-sql/introducing-budget-bytes

item.title: Join Microsoft at NDC London 2026 - Let’s Build the Future of .NET Together
item.description: NDC London is here, with pre-conference workshops running January 26–27 and the main conference running January 28–30. If you're a .NET or Azure developer, this is the place to be. Whether you want to sharpen your cloud-native skills, get hands-on with AI-powered development, learn from Microsoft engineers, or simply connect with people wh Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/dotnet/join-us-at-ndc-london-2026

item.title: Introducing the Evals for Agent Interop starter kit
item.description: As enterprise customers roll out and govern AI agents through Agent 365, they have been asking for pre canned evals they can run out of the box. They want transparent, reproducible evaluations that reflect their own work in realistic environments, including interoperability, how agents con Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/microsoft365dev/introducing-the-evals-for-agent-interop-starter-kit

item.title: What's the difference between Safe­Array­Access­Data and Safe­Array­Add­Ref?
item.description: Once upon a time, there was SAFEARRAY, the representation of an array used by IDispatch and intended for use as a common mechanism for interchange of data between native code and scripting languages such as Visual Basic. You used the Safe­Array­Create function to create one, and a variety of other fu Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/oldnewthing/20260126-00/?p=112016

item.title: Giving Agents a Visual Voice: MCP Apps Support in VS Code
item.description: VS Code now supports MCP Apps, enabling AI agents to display interactive UIs for richer developer workflows. Read the full article Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/vscode-blog/giving-agents-a-visual-voice:-mcp-apps-support-in-vs-code
